issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

projectCategory.description: Titanium and related SDKs used in application development
projectCategory.name: Client

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: The issue is considered finished, the resolution is correct. Issues which are closed can be reopened.
status.name: Closed

fields.description:
{html}

ATM I've only seen this happen in linux..

When a project is first deployed onto a new emulator, sometimes you get an error during the initial copy to /sdcard. If this error occurs, you will see a crash when the app boots up for the first time. (The trace will say that it can't find /sdcard/Ti.debug/$yourappid/app.js)

A temporary workaround:

  • Close the app
  • Uninstall from the emulator (Home > Menu > Settings > Applications > Manage Applications > > Uninstall)
  • Close the emulator
  • Hit "Launch" again from Developer
{html}
fields.summary: Initial copy of project resources to /sdcard sometimes fails

comments.body:
{html}

This bug should be fixed as of this commit:
http://github.com/appcelerator/titanium_mobile/commit/d59cfdcd52886...

{html}
